meanings.definition: A dull, heavy sound, such as that made by an object falling to the ground.
meanings.sent1: The thud of the book hitting the floor startled me.
meanings.sent2: I heard a loud thud when the rock fell from the cliff.
meanings.sent3: The thud of the watermelon hitting the ground was surprisingly loud.
meanings.sent4: The thud of the hammer against the wall echoed through the room.
meanings.sent5: The thud of the heavy door closing behind him signaled his departure.

meanings.definition: To make a dull, heavy sound when hitting something.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally thud the door while carrying the groceries.
meanings.sent2: The tree branch thudded against the window during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The basketball thudded against the backboard and bounced away.
meanings.sent4: His heart thudded loudly in his chest as he approached the stage.
meanings.sent5: The raindrops thudded against the roof, creating a soothing rhythm.

meanings.definition: The sound of a heavy object hitting a surface with a dull impact.
meanings.sent1: The thud of the hammer against the wood echoed in the workshop.
meanings.sent2: The thud of the rock hitting the window woke me up.
meanings.sent3: The thud of the basketball hitting the ground signaled the end of the game.
meanings.sent4: The thud of the suitcase hitting the floor indicated their arrival.
meanings.sent5: The thud of the falling tree branch startled the birds nearby.
